description:
Population in private households

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The presentation of households and their structures is based
on the population in households. Included are all persons
who run a household alone (one-person household) or together
with other people (multi-person household) at their main or
second residence. They are also called household members.
The population in collective living quarters (e.g.
inhabitants of old peoples' homes) is excluded, while
households within collective living quarters are included
(e.g. household of the director). As a rule, the population
in households is not broken down by main and second
residence. As a person may be entitled to accommodation in
several households, he or she may be counted multiple times.
The absent household reference person, for example, who
lives in another municipality and has a second residence as
a subtenant there, is part of two households. First, such
persons belong to the household of their family and second,
as subtenants, they are regarded as separate households.
With a view to issues of infrastructural planning, this is
justified by the fact that households use residential space
and the facilities of the respective municipality at each
place of residence.
